Link your corporation with Bonnet House and become VIP hosts of our events, education programs, dinners and evenings on the veranda. Click on link below to become a new member or renew your membership. Become a member or Renew your membership You can also participate in the magic of Bonnet House as a volunteer, lead tours or students through the property, teach art classes or guide nature walks. Your benefits also include enhancements, such as: Complimentary tours (specialty tours not included) Special Discounts Gifts Priority at Special Events Recognition in the Annual Report If you have any membership questions, please email [email protected] . Learn more about the different types of Bonnet House Membership INDIVIDUAL or FAMILY ARTIST BARTLETT Membership in Bonnet House is a wonderful way to show your support for this rare example of Old South Florida while also enjoying valuable recreation and entertainment opportunities for you and your family. All basic membership benefits include: Unlimited Free Admission for Year of Membership (specialty and guided tours not included) Half-price admission for up to three guests accompanied by the member Discounts for events, lectures, and classes Reciprocal discounts: 100% off general admission at Flamingo Gardens and 50% off general admission at BOK Towers Garden and Naples Botanical Garden Subscription to Bonnet House Newsletter and… The satisfaction of knowing that a membership in Bonnet House is helping to support and preserve a South Florida treasure! Individual Level $65 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for one 10% gift shop discount (20% in May & November) Become an Individual Level Member Dual Level $100 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission to Bonnet House pass for two 10% gift shop discount (20% in May and November) Become a Dual Level Member Family Level $135 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for two plus all children in the household under age 18 10% gift shop discount (20% in May and November) Become a Family Level Member Hibiscus Level $250 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for two plus all children in household under age 18 Two general admission tickets to a Holiday Magic Evening Experience (please email [email protected] to reserve your tickets) 15% gift shop discount (20% in May and November) Complimentary guided tour admission for members. $15 guided tour admission for up to three guests. Registration is required by calling (954)278-8791 Become a Hibiscus Level Member Orchid Level $500 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for two plus all children in the household under age 18 One ticket to the Holiday Magic VIP Opening Reception (please email [email protected] to reserve your ticket). An invitation for two to an “Evening on the Veranda” Annual Donor reception and private house tour 15% gift shop discount (20% in May & November) Complimentary guided tour admission for members. $15 guided tour admission for up to three guests. Registration is required by calling (954) 278-8791. Become an Orchid Level Member Golden Shell Level $1,000 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for four plus all children in household under age 18 Two tickets to the Holiday Magic VIP Opening Reception (please email [email protected] to reserve your tickets). An invitation for two to an “Evening on the Veranda” Annual Donor reception and private house tour Private tour of house and grounds for 6 (please call to reserve time) 15% gift shop discount (20% in May and November) Become a Golden Shell Member The Bonnet House Fine Artists are a group of accomplished artists, whose work is often inspired by the lush and tropical Bonnet Grounds. Bonnet House Fine Artists members exhibit and sell their work on the Bonnet House property and at various galleries, museums, and public sites throughout the community. Membership is open to artists working in any media. All basic membership benefits include: Unlimited Free Admission for Year of Membership (specialty and guided tours not included), Half-price admission for up to three guests accompanied by member, Discounts for events, lectures, and classes, Subscription to Bonnet House newsletter and… The satisfaction of knowing that a membership in Bonnet House is helping to support and preserve a South Florida treasure! All basic membership benefits plus: Access to the property for drawing, painting, or still photography during regular tour hours, Eligibility to participate in Bonnet House Fine Art Exhibits and Sales Programs. Fine Artist Member Art Exhibits rotate every two months. A Call for Entries will be sent out to all current Fine Artist Members with a link to apply. The first 26 artists to respond will get the opportunity to exhibit one piece in the upcoming show. Look out for future dates on this page: Rotating Exhibits – Bonnet House . You must be an active Fine Artist member to participate. The satisfaction of knowing that membership in Bonnet House is helping to support and preserve a South Florida treasure! Individual Fine Artist Level $80 Dual Fine Artist Level $115 Become a Fine Artist Level Member If you have any membership questions, please call 954-278-8791 Golden Shell Level $1,000 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for four plus all children in household under age 18 Two tickets to the Holiday Magic VIP Opening Reception (please call (954) 278-8791 or email [email protected] to reserve your tickets) An invitation for two to an “Evening on the Veranda” Annual Donor reception and private house tour Private tour of house and grounds for 6 (please call to reserve time) 15% gift shop discount (20% in May and November) Complimentary guided tour admission for members. $15 guided tour admission for up to three guests. Registration is required by calling (954) 703-2606. $2,500 BARTLETT CIRCLE All Golden Shell Level benefits plus: •Opportunity to host private lunch for 16 at Bonnet House location of your choice (catering responsibility of donor) $5,000 SILVER BARTLETT CIRCLE All Golden Shell Level benefits plus: •Opportunity to host private dinner at Bonnet House location of your choice for up to 16 people (catering responsibility of donor) •Free use of Island Theater for four meetings per year •Recognition as sponsor for one of the following rooms/areas during the year of membership with appropriate, prominent signage commemorating donation (subject to choice by prior donor): Music Room • Butler’s Pantry • Bamboo Bar • Shell Museum • Boat House • Orchid Showroom • Hibiscus Garden • Citrus Courtyard $10,000 GOLDEN BARTLETT CIRCLE All Golden Shell Level benefits plus: •Opportunity to host private event at Bonnet House location of your choice for up to 32 people (catering responsibility of donor) •Free use of Island Theater for four meetings per year •Recognition as sponsor for one of the following rooms/areas during the year of membership with appropriate, prominent signage commemorating donation (subject to choice by prior donor) Drawing Room • Studio • Art Gallery Become a member The Bartlett Circle memberships are the premier levels of Bonnet House memberships. Donors at these levels demonstrate an extraordinary commitment to Bonnet House Museum & Gardens and receive benefits that enable them to relive the Bartlett lifestyle. In recognition of the extraordinary support provided by Bartlett Circle members, memberships at these levels can be individually tailored to best suit member needs. Benefits include annual naming opportunities for rooms and areas of the Bonnet House property as well as opportunities to hold a private event at Bonnet House.  For further information, contact Bonnet House Membership Coordinator, Lauren Weissman at [email protected] + INDIVIDUAL or FAMILY Membership in Bonnet House is a wonderful way to show your support for this rare example of Old South Florida while also enjoying valuable recreation and entertainment opportunities for you and your family. All basic membership benefits include: Unlimited Free Admission for Year of Membership (specialty and guided tours not included) Half-price admission for up to three guests accompanied by the member Discounts for events, lectures, and classes Reciprocal discounts: 100% off general admission at Flamingo Gardens and 50% off general admission at BOK Towers Garden and Naples Botanical Garden Subscription to Bonnet House Newsletter and… The satisfaction of knowing that a membership in Bonnet House is helping to support and preserve a South Florida treasure! Registration is required by calling (954)278-8791 Become a Hibiscus Level Member Orchid Level $500 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for two plus all children in the household under age 18 One ticket to the Holiday Magic VIP Opening Reception (please email [email protected] to reserve your ticket). An invitation for two to an “Evening on the Veranda” Annual Donor reception and private house tour 15% gift shop discount (20% in May & November) Complimentary guided tour admission for members. $15 guided tour admission for up to three guests. Registration is required by calling (954) 278-8791. Become an Orchid Level Member Golden Shell Level $1,000 All basic membership benefits plus: Annual admission pass to Bonnet House for four plus all children in household under age 18 Two tickets to the Holiday Magic VIP Opening Reception (please email [email protected] to reserve your tickets). An invitation for two to an “Evening on the Veranda” Annual Donor reception and private house tour Private tour of house and grounds for 6 (please call to reserve time) 15% gift shop discount (20% in May and November) Become a Golden Shell Member + ARTIST The Bonnet House Fine Artists are a group of accomplished artists, whose work is often inspired by the lush and tropical Bonnet Grounds. Bonnet House Fine Artists members exhibit and sell their work on the Bonnet House property and at various galleries, museums, and public sites throughout the community. Membership is open to artists working in any media. All basic membership benefits include: Unlimited Free Admission for Year of Membership (specialty and guided tours not included), Half-price admission for up to three guests accompanied by member, Discounts for events, lectures, and classes, Subscription to Bonnet House newsletter and… The satisfaction of knowing that a membership in Bonnet House is helping to support and preserve a South Florida treasure! All basic membership benefits plus: Access to the property for drawing, painting, or still photography during regular tour hours, Eligibility to participate in Bonnet House Fine Art Exhibits and Sales Programs. Fine Artist Member Art Exhibits rotate every two months. A Call for Entries will be sent out to all current Fine Artist Members with a link to apply. The first 26 artists to respond will get the opportunity to exhibit one piece in the upcoming show. Look out for future dates on this page: Rotating Exhibits – Bonnet House . You must be an active Fine Artist member to participate. The satisfaction of knowing that membership in Bonnet House is helping to support and preserve a South Florida treasure! Registration is required by calling (954) 703-2606. $2,500 BARTLETT CIRCLE All Golden Shell Level benefits plus: •Opportunity to host private lunch for 16 at Bonnet House location of your choice (catering responsibility of donor) $5,000 SILVER BARTLETT CIRCLE All Golden Shell Level benefits plus: •Opportunity to host private dinner at Bonnet House location of your choice for up to 16 people (catering responsibility of donor) •Free use of Island Theater for four meetings per year •Recognition as sponsor for one of the following rooms/areas during the year of membership with appropriate, prominent signage commemorating donation (subject to choice by prior donor): Music Room • Butler’s Pantry • Bamboo Bar • Shell Museum • Boat House • Orchid Showroom • Hibiscus Garden • Citrus Courtyard $10,000 GOLDEN BARTLETT CIRCLE All Golden Shell Level benefits plus: •Opportunity to host private event at Bonnet House location of your choice for up to 32 people (catering responsibility of donor) •Free use of Island Theater for four meetings per year •Recognition as sponsor for one of the following rooms/areas during the year of membership with appropriate, prominent signage commemorating donation (subject to choice by prior donor) Drawing Room • Studio • Art Gallery Become a member The Bartlett Circle memberships are the premier levels of Bonnet House memberships. Donors at these levels demonstrate an extraordinary commitment to Bonnet House Museum & Gardens and receive benefits that enable them to relive the Bartlett lifestyle. In recognition of the extraordinary support provided by Bartlett Circle members, memberships at these levels can be individually tailored to best suit member needs. Benefits include annual naming opportunities for rooms and areas of the Bonnet House property as well as opportunities to hold a private event at Bonnet House.  For further information, contact Bonnet House Membership Coordinator, Lauren Weissman at [email protected]
SUPPORT Bonnet House has survived with remarkable authenticity – reflecting the creative lifestyle of its artist owners and preserving the natural setting of Old South Florida. Help preserve this historic artist’s estate. Make a donation today! Make Your Donation B onnet House Museum & Gardens is the unique legacy of Frederic and Evelyn Bartlett. This whimsical estate located on 35 acres between the Atlantic Ocean and the Intracoastal Waterway preserves the home of these two American artists. It offers a glimpse into their life style and the world of art and Florida in the early 20th Century. Help us maintain their legacy for now and years to come. Your tax deductible contribution will go toward the maintenance and operations of Bonnet House Museum & Gardens. Please help us keep the doors open for everyone with your donation TODAY. Thanks so much for your consideration and support! Make Your Donation Leave a Legacy and Support Bonnet House in Perpetuity With a Chari­table Gift An­nuity (CGA), you can make a long-lasting impact for the preservation of Bonnet House-and here’s what you get in return for your gift: Receive stable, fixed payments for the rest of your life, regardless of fluctuations in the market Pay less tax on those payments than regular income Get a charitable deduction for the current market value of your gift and face no liability for the capital gains when you fund your gift with appreciated stock Receive payments immediately or defer them to a future date when you may need additional income. The minimum age is 60 and the minimum gift is $10,000. Some payout rates are as follows: Age 70 – 5.1% annually Age 75 – 5.8% annually Age 80 – 6.8% annually Age 85 – 7.8 % annually No wonder the Charitable Gift Annuity is such a pop­ular gift. It gives long-term support for your loved ones, Bonnet House, and you! Contact Patrick to get individualized information detailing what your annuity payments and interest rates would be: Patrick Shavloske, CEO, [email protected] Make Your Donation Row Backgrounds Simple Share Buttons Adder (8.5.2) simplesharebuttons.com Facebook Google Twitter Pinterest Tumblr Linkedin Reddit Email Print It's only fair to share... Events & Celebrations
/container
/swiper-slide
Corporate Events, Meetings, Celebrations, Private Affairs and Cocktail Receptions Venue in the Heart of Fort Lauderdale
Bonnet House offers a beautiful, outdoor garden setting for corporate affairs, cocktail receptions and dinner celebrations. Beginning with the first impression at the main entrance, your guests will experience a night to remember, as they are transported back in time when life was less hectic.
Play Video
For more information or to set up an appointment please
call
(954) 703-2608
or email
[email protected]
.
Property Rental Rates
Preferred Vendor List
The tranquility of the courtyard fountain and garden setting in the main house makes for a lovely arrival.  The adjacent waterfront veranda or Bonnet House Beach is the perfect location to celebrate any special event or to host your company’s meeting or retreat.
Bonnet House’s rental fee is for the venue only.
Hugh’s Catering
has partnered with Bonnet House to serve all your event planning needs. From delightful fare to detailed logistics, Alexander Event Catering is amongst the go-to destination management and catering companies that will handle your event with the utmost professionalism. A more extensive list of
pre-approved vendors
that have experience on the property is also available.

#tribe-events-header
Event featured image, but exclude link
Event content
Step into a vibrant celebration of local creativity in the Gallery’s middle room, where the
Bonnet House Fine Artists’ Exhibits
showcase a rotating collection of works by talented regional artists.
Join us for each exhibit’s
opening reception
, where you’ll enjoy a sparkling wine welcome, delicious hors d’oeuvres, and a cash bar offering beer, wine, and soda.
It’s a relaxed and inviting setting—
perfect for connecting with the artists and fellow art enthusiasts.
$5 Members, $10 Non-Members (Pre-registration is required)
Click here
to purchase tickets.
Generously sponsored by:
Kimpton Shorebreak Fort Lauderdale Beach Resort,
Brody & Brody, P.A. & Mary Joe and Richard Brown.

FRIENDS AND PLACES YOU MIGHT ALSO ENJOY
At the
Ah-Tah-Thi-Ki Museum at Okalee
one can experience the history, culture and art of the Seminole Indian people. The museum features various exhibits, retail Art Gallery and an awesome Museum Store. (located in Big Cypress Reservation)
The American Alliance
of Museums
has been bringing museums together since 1906, helping to develop standards and best practices, gathering and sharing knowledge, and providing advocacy on issues of concern to the entire museum community. We are dedicated to ensuring that museums remain a vital part of the American landscape, connecting people with the greatest achievements of the human experience, past, present and future.
ArtsCalendar.com
where you can get times and locations for theatre, music, dance, visual arts & museums.
ArtsCalendar.com
is the leading online resource for Arts and Cultural Events
Business for the Arts of Broward
is about “getting business leaders together and educating them on the tremendous economic vitality of arts and culture in
Broward County
,” BankAtlantic CEO Jarett Levan, chairman of the organization, said. “Business for the Arts of Broward aims to turn corporate leaders into “advocates for the entire cultural landscape.”.
The Community Foundation of Broward
provides community leadership, fosters bold philanthropy and builds permanent resources to tackle Broward’s biggest challenges – today and forever.
The Deering Estate at Cutler
– One of the most unique parks in south Florida. A Florida environmental, archaeological, historical and architectural preserve. The Estate is an island of palms and wildlife in the midst of suburbia, Miami, Florida.
Fort Lauderdale Historical Society
was founded in 1962 to collect, preserve and interpret the history of Fort Lauderdale and Broward County. In 2005 the Historical Society completed the historic village which features the largest remaining collection of early 20th century buildings in Broward County.
Fort Lauderdale, Florida Vacation & Travel Guide
Glen Helen Nature Preserve
–
Located in Ohio, the Glen Helen Nature Preserve has a unique connection to Bonnet House. Hugh Taylor Birch bought and then donated the land that would then be named Glen Helen in memory of his daughter and Frederic’s second wife, Helen Birch Bartlett.
Great Locations
is a quality area guidebook serving Greater Fort Lauderdale, the Florida Keys/ Key West and the Palm Beaches. It’s a must for any visitor!
Fort Lauderdale’s
Historic Stranahan House Museum
is like a magical journey through time. Experience a link to the time when the Seminole Indians made friends with the settlers in what is now known as Fort Lauderdale.
The Heard Museum
in Phoenix, Arizona, is a private, non-profit museum founded in 1929 by Dwight B. and Maie Bartlett Heard to house their personal collection of cultural and fine arts of Native peoples, with an emphasis on the Southwest US.
Hemingway House
– Key West – Experience the calming contrast that this Key West home offered this complex man as you take a leisurely and inspiring tour of his mansion and gardens.
John Knox Village
is an award-winning Life Plan Community for seniors 62 and better, located in Pompano Beach, situated on a 70-acre lush, tropical campus.  It is home to 1,000 residents who enjoy unsurpassed amenities, resort-style living, and the peace of mind that comes with knowing their healthcare needs will be covered, no matter what arises on the road ahead.
The Jungle Queen
, Fort Lauderdale’s legendary Riverboat, has carried visitors’ around the waterways of our city for over 60 years. There are three distinct cruises available, the dinner cruise, the sightseeing cruise and the bayside cruise. Each is an experience not to be missed.
Preservations Directory
– The online resource for historic preservation, building restoration and cultural resource management in the United States & Canada.
Sea Rocket Adventures
–
Located at the famous Bahia Mar Resort & Marina in the heart of Fort Lauderdale Beach, Sea Rocket offers parasailing adventures that will take you hundreds of feet in the air above the pristine waters of the Atlantic and beautiful sights of South Florida! Enjoy 10% off using the code BONNETHOUSE10. Book online now to reserve your spot or call 844-524-2359!
Sea Turtle Oversight Protection
The mission of STOP is to rescue disoriented sea turtle hatchlings in Broward County, Florida. Click on link if you are interested in volunteering. You can help rescue sea turtles on the Bonnet House Beach and throughout Broward County.
Vizcaya Museum and Gardens
is a National Historic Landmark; and a museum owned by Miami-Dade County. Vizcaya was built by American industrialist James Deering, who wintered on the property from 1916–1925. Today, the European-inspired estate includes a house filled with art and furnishings, ten acres of gardens on Biscayne Bay, a hardwood hammock, and an historic village in Miami, Florida.
The Water Taxi
runs between Oakland Park Boulevard and Southeast 17th Street along the Intracoastal waterway, and west along the New River into downtown Ft. Lauderdale as far as River House. A unique way to travel through the Venice of America. Bonnet House will be a water stop soon.

Bonnet House, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, EIN 65-0161955.
Funding for this organization is provided in part by the Broward County Board of County Commissioners as recommended by the Broward Cultural Council. Support for the educational programs is provided in part by the State of Florida, Department of State, Division of Arts and Culture and the Florida Council on Arts and Culture.
Bonnet House Museum & Gardens
900 North Birch Road Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33304
(954) 563-5393

hicago-born artist Frederic Clay Bartlett created Bonnet House in 1920 on South Florida oceanfront land given to him and his second wife, Helen Louise Birch, by her father, Hugh Taylor Birch, a prominent Chicago attorney, real estate investor, and naturalist. Tragedy struck in 1925 when Helen died from breast cancer and in 1931 Frederic married Evelyn Fortune Lilly. She spent winters at Bonnet House until 1995. Today, the estate is a preeminent house museum dedicated not only to historic and environmental preservation, but also to learning and creative expression – much like the Bartletts and Birches themselves.
In both words and lush color photography,
Bonnet House: A Legacy of Artistry and Elegance
,
tells the story of both Bonnet House Museum & Gardens and the creativity of these families.
Click here
to view sample pages.
Bonnet House, Inc. is a nonprofit, 501c3, whose mission is to celebrate the story of Frederic and Evelyn Bartlett, we preserve the art, history and nature of Bonnet House, providing inspiration and respite for all.

HISTORY
B
y the time early settler Hugh Taylor Birch purchased the Bonnet House site in 1895, the grounds had already witnessed 4,000 years of Florida history. Bonnet House’s modern history began when Birch gave the Bonnet House property as a wedding gift to his daughter Helen and her husband, Chicago artist Frederic Clay Bartlett in 1919. Upon Helen’s death, Frederic’s visits to Bonnet House became sporadic until 1931 when he married Evelyn Fortune Lilly. Together they embellished Bonnet House with the decorative elements that delight visitors to this day.
Learn more | View History & House Gallery
ART
Fort Lauderdale Historic Art Museum, Gallery, and Studio
F
rederic Clay Bartlett graduated from Munich’s prestigious Royal Academy in 1895 and returned to a prolific and prosperous career in the United States.  He worked on mural projects in conjunction with American architects and his easel work can today be found in the best museums including the Carnegie Institute and the Art Institute of Chicago.
Examples of his easel art are displayed in the Bonnet House studio and Frederic’s murals and faux painting can be found throughout the Main House.
With little formal training but much encouragement from Frederic, Evelyn Fortune Lilly began painting in 1932.  For six years, she painted prolifically, and her work was featured in well-received gallery exhibits in Boston, New York, and Indianapolis. Evelyn’s works are today displayed in Bonnet House’s Carl J. Weinhardt Gallery.
Learn more | View Art Gallery
GARDENS
Tropical Tranquility – Historic South Florida
I
n addition to their historic significance, the Bonnet House grounds encompass one of the last examples in South Florida of a native barrier island habitat. Five distinct ecosystems can be found on the property including the Atlantic Ocean beach and primary dune, a fresh water slough, the secondary dune which includes the house site, mangrove wetlands, and a maritime forest.
Learn more | View Gardens Gallery
